channel.title: BBC Sport - Sport

item.title: Ashes 2019: Steve Smith century frustrates England in first Test
item.description: Steve Smith makes 144 on his return to Test cricket after the ball-tampering scandal to halt England's charge on the opening day of the Ashes.

item.title: Nicolas Pepe: Arsenal sign Lille winger for club record fee
item.description: Arsenal sign Ivory Coast winger Nicolas Pepe from Lille for a club record fee of £72m.

item.title: Max Verstappen: Red Bull driver not thinking about title
item.description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen has rejected claims he is favourite for Sunday's Hungarian Grand Prix and a potential title contender.

item.title: Ashes 2019: England's James Anderson apologised after injuring calf
item.description: James Anderson apologised to the England bowlers for bowling only four overs because of a calf injury on day one of the opening Ashes Test.

item.title: Europa League: Wolves ease to qualifier win over Crusaders in Belfast
item.description: Wolves progress to the Europa League third qualifying round after a comfortable 4-1 victory over Crusaders secures a 6-1 aggregate win.

item.title: Cincinnati Reds v Pittsburgh Pirates: MLB hands out eight bans after mass brawl
item.description: MLB hands out eight bans after five-minute mass brawl between Cincinnati Reds and Pittsburgh Pirates players.

item.title: Aberdeen 5-0 Chikhura Sachkhere (6-1): Sam Cosgrove scored Europa League treble
item.description: Sam Cosgrove scored a hat-trick as rampant Aberdeen earned a Europa League third qualifying round date with Rijeka by easing past Chikhura of Georgia.

item.title: Dylan Teuns: Belgian cyclist suffers freak gardening injury
item.description: Tour de France stage winner Dylan Teuns suffers freak gardening injury which needs 15 stitches.

item.title: Inter Miami: David Beckham MLS franchise expect to sign English players
item.description: David Beckham's Inter Miami expect to recruit English players before their MLS debut in 2020, says co-owner Jorge Mas.

item.title: Women's British Open: Charley Hull makes strong start
item.description: England's Charley Hull has started strongly in her bid to win a first major title at the Women's British Open at Woburn.

item.title: New Premier League football season: Can the 'Big Six' monopoly be broken?
item.description: With some of the Premier League's 'Big Six' looking vulnerable, could a new club break through this season?

item.title: Khadijah Mellah: Hijab-wearing jockey triumphs on Haverland and makes history
item.description: Amateur jockey Khadijah Mellah makes history as she wins the Magnolia Cup at Glorious Goodwood on Thursday.

item.title: Football's new laws - changes to backpasses, penalties, handballs and subs for 2019-20
item.description: Goalkeepers picking up backpasses (sort of), uncontested drop balls and more handball decisions are among football's new laws for 2019-20.

item.title: 'My bowling isn't beautiful, I don't care!' - Romanian Pavel Florin defends 'unusual' bowling style
item.description: Romanian Pavel Florin goes viral for his unusual bowling style in the European Cricket League, with the 40-year-old Cluj player admitting his action is "not beautiful".

item.title: Khadijah Mellah: Hijab-wearing jockey triumphs on Haverland and makes history
item.description: Khadijah Mellah becomes the first hijab-wearing jockey to race at Goodwood and wins the Magnolia Cup aboard Haverland.

item.title: Ashes 2019: AB de Villiers shares his predictions on the batting line-ups
item.description: Legendary South Africa batsman AB de Villiers gives us the batting low-down for this summer's Ashes.

item.title: ‘I’ve hit rock bottom’ – NBA star Lin tears up about future
item.description: NBA star Jeremy Lin feels the league "has given up on him" after finding himself without a team for next season.

item.title: Ashes 2019: England & Australia pace attacks is fire versus fire - Sir Curtly Ambrose
item.description: Legendary West Indies fast bowler Sir Curtly Ambrose talks us through the pace attacks of England and Australia before the Ashes series starts.

item.title: World Thumb Wrestling Championships: Inside event in Norfolk
item.description: BBC Sport gets the inside track on the World Thumb Wrestling Championships in Norfolk and meets four-time champion Paul Browse.

item.title: Interviewing John Stones on a boat - the pre-season Premier League diaries
item.description: Watch the final part of Simon Stone's football pre-season tour behind-the-scenes series, including interview with Manchester City's John Stones on a boat.

item.title: Ronaldo, De Ligt, Winks & Mata - watch Simon Stone's pre-season diaries
item.description: Watch part two of Simon Stone's behind-the-scenes series as he witnesses a Ronaldo frenzy, speaks to Tottenham's Harry Winks and Manchester United's Juan Mata.

item.title: Pep Guardiola: 'Phil Foden is most talented player I have ever seen in my career'
item.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says Phil Foden is the 'most, most, most talented player' he has seen in his career.
